author: Lauren Rosenthal, Brian K Sullivan
description: The US Navy will no longer distribute certain satellite readings, a move that will leave forecasters without important insights into storms’ strength and structure.
title: As Hurricane Season Picks Up, Key Forecasting Tool Access Set to End

author: Ryan Chua
description: President Donald Trump indicated that he might be preparing to ease his “maximum pressure” campaign against Iran, potentially undercutting a central policy dating to his first term and provoking consternation among foreign policy hawks who argue that now is the time to escalate — not lessen — pressure on Tehran.
title: Trump’s Iran Oil Comments Strain His ‘Maximum Pressure’ Policy

author: Alex Wickham, Ailbhe Rea, Joe Mayes
description: Keir Starmer agreed to pare back a divisive £5 billion ($6.9 billion) cut to welfare to quiet a rebellion by his own party, a decision that will likely leave both Britain’s fiscal plans and the prime minister’s own leadership in need of repair.
title: Starmer Eases Welfare Cuts in Blow to Budget, and His Authority

author: Maeve Sheehey, Lillianna Byington
description: For Republicans racing to pass President Donald Trump’s mega-bill, the devil is in the procedural details.
title: How the Senate Parliamentarian Tripped Up Trump’s Tax Bill

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The US and China have finalized a trade understanding reached last month in Geneva, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said.
title: US, China Have Finalized Tariff Understanding, Lutnick Says

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s top court ordered lawmakers to complete the inaugural session of parliament within 30 days, pressing politicians to resolve a stalemate which has prevented the formation of a new government since February’s election.
title: Kosovo Court Orders Parliament to End Deadlock Within 30 Days

author: Anna J Kaiser
description: Miami’s city commission voted to postpone municipal elections set for November, giving the mayor and two commissioners another year in office in defiance of Governor Ron DeSantis.
title: Miami Defies DeSantis by Delaying Mayoral Election Until 2026

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s bill to speed up the construction of major projects such as pipelines, mines and electricity lines has passed Canada’s Senate and will soon become law.
title: Carney’s Bill to Fast-Track Major Projects Set to Become Law

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Michael Nienaber
description: European Union leaders are discussing their response to President Donald Trump’s latest proposal on trade after a briefing from Ursula von der Leyen.
title: EU Briefs Divided Leaders on Trump’s Counterproposal on Tariffs

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the Republican drive to get their tax-cut bill passed. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Makes a Final Push to Get His Tax-Cut Bill Passed

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The centerpiece of Donald Trump’s legislative agenda just hit a roadblock in an obscure official who suddenly wields huge power: Senate Parliamentarian Elizabeth MacDonough.
title: An Obscure Official Wields Huge Clout Over Trump Tax Bill

author: Erik Wasson
description: New York Republican Nick LaLota called Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s latest offer on the state and local tax deduction “insulting” and “disgusting,” raising serious questions about whether the GOP can strike a deal on the tax and spending bill.
title: NY House Member Says He’s Disgusted With Bessent’s SALT Offer

author: Daniel Flatley, Lauren Vella
description: The Treasury Department announced a deal with G-7 allies that will exclude US companies from some taxes imposed by other countries in exchange for removing the Section 899 “revenge tax” proposal from President Donald Trump’s tax bill.
title: Treasury Deal Halts ‘Revenge Tax’ That Spooked Wall Street

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Donors and advisers mounting a campaign to convince Andrew Cuomo to drop out of the New York City mayor’s race are facing an imminent deadline to get his name off the ballot.
title: Andrew Cuomo Faces Friday Deadline to Exit NYC Mayor’s Race

author: Chris Strohm
description: The US Justice Department has begun an investigation into whether the schools in the 10-campus University of California system are violating federal law through discriminatory hiring practices.
title: Justice Department Investigates Hiring by University of California

author: Emily Birnbaum, Oma Seddiq
description: Republicans’ latest attempt to use President Donald Trump’s massive tax package to ban US states from enforcing artificial intelligence regulations has hit a snag that endangers a provision favored by AI titans.
title: Future of States’ AI Laws Hinges on Senate Rules for Tax Bill

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Bill Ackman issued a call to his 1.8 million followers on social media to ask for suggestions on the “best centrist” candidate to take on Zohran Mamdani in the race for New York City’s mayor this November.
title: Ackman Wants a New Rival to Take on ‘Superb’ Mamdani in NYC

author: Laurence Arnold
description: Carolyn McCarthy, the New York congresswoman motivated to enter politics by the shooting of her husband and son, only to find gun control a difficult sell in Washington, has died. She was 81.
title: Carolyn McCarthy, NY’s ‘Gun Lady’ in Congress, Dies at 81

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: An Indian negotiating team has arrived in the US, seeking to secure an interim trade deal before a July 9 deadline when higher US tariffs are set to kick in, people familiar with the matter said.
title: India Trade Team Arrives in US for Talks as July Deadline Looms

author: Martin Z Braun, Sri Taylor
description: New York City mayoral hopeful Zohran Mamdani has rattled Wall Street with his plans to raise taxes on the rich, freeze rents and boost spending to pay for free childcare and education at the city’s public universities.
title: NYC’s Bond Investors Calm Wall Street Anxiety Over Mamdani Rise

author: Ailbhe Rea, Joe Mayes
description: Keir Starmer has pivoted to deal-making mode in a bid to stave off a damaging defeat on welfare cuts that are key to his chancellor’s efforts to balance the UK books.
title: Starmer Swings From Defiance to Deal-Making to Save Welfare Bill

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovakia is withholding support for the European Union’s latest raft of sanctions against Moscow unless its concerns about energy security are taken into account.
title: Slovakia Vows to Veto Russia Sanctions Without Gas Guarantees

author: Kate Sullivan
description: The White House said Donald Trump’s decision on a successor for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is not near, after the Wall Street Journal reported the president could make a pick as soon as the summer.
title: Trump Decision on Next Fed Chair Not Imminent, White House Says

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s president responded defiantly to US measures that could cripple three prominent local banks on accusations of potential money laundering tied to drug trafficking, arguing she’s seen no evidence to support the crackdown.
title: Sheinbaum Disputes US Money Laundering Claims Against Mexican Banks

author: Mathieu Dion
description: A group of Canadian steel producers said the government’s plan to restrict foreign steel imports isn’t strong enough and warned that the industry is set to shed thousands more jobs because of US tariffs.
title: Canada Steel Firms Say Weak Tariff Response Risks Wider Layoffs

author: Malcolm Scott, Yoshiaki Nohara, Shruti Srivastava, Philip Heijmans
description: Tariff negotiations with the Trump administration are running into roadblocks, as partners including Japan, India and the European Union balk at signing deals without knowing how badly they’ll be hit by separate levies on exports including chips, drugs and steel.
title: Trump’s Threat of More Tariffs Makes US Trade Partners Wary of Signing Deals

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said Thursday an agreement is within reach on some changes to the contentious pension reform.
title: French Premier Says Agreement Close on Some Pension Law Changes

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Katharina Rosskopf, Sanne Wass
description: European Union leaders are set to debate their strategy in response to President Donald Trump’s trade war, with the likely choices coming down to accepting an unbalanced deal or risking escalation by striking back.
title: EU Firms Up Trade Strategy Ahead of Trump’s Tariff Deadline

author: Nduka Orjinmo, Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu has signed four new tax laws, marking the latest chapter in his push to reform the economy of Africa’s most populous nation.
title: Nigeria’s Tinubu Signs New Tax Law in Latest Step in Reform Push

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada’s budget watchdog urged Prime Minister Mark Carney to release an update on the federal government’s finances soon or risk eroding the government’s credibility with investors.
title: Canada’s Budget Watchdog Urges Carney to Show Numbers as Spending Rises

author: Shruti Singh, Miranda Davis
description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker unveiled his bid for a third term with an attempt to position himself as a champion of voters’ economic concerns and a foil to President Donald Trump.
title: Pritzker Seeks Third Illinois Term With Eye Also on White House

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Erik Wasson, Erin Durkin
description: A Republican plan to cut $250 billion in Medicaid and other health care spending hit a procedural roadblock in the Senate Thursday, complicating efforts to pass Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package.
title: Trump Tax Bill Hits $250 Billion Health Care Roadblock in Senate

author: Courtney McBride, Ramsey Al-Rikabi, Anthony Capaccio
description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth used a press briefing Thursday to berate the media over reports that questioned the effectiveness of strikes on Iran’s nuclear program, without offering new information.
title: Hegseth Berates Media as Questions Linger on Iran Strike Impact

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russia plans to launch a state-run messaging application that aims to host some government services, giving existing platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram a homegrown competitor in the country.
title: Russia Aims to Launch State Messenger to Compete With App Giants

author: Lucille Liu
description: A Harvard University academic who met with top Chinese officials including Foreign Minister Wang Yi said he expects the US and China to agree to a memorandum of understanding on trade as early as next week.
title: Harvard Academic Who Met Top Chinese Diplomat Sees US Trade Breakthrough Soon

author: Ewa Krukowska, Alberto Nardelli, Samy Adghirni
description: The European Union’s interim climate plan for 2040 faces a pushback at a summit of the bloc’s leaders, where French President Emmanuel Macron plans to stress the need for competitive industry during the green transition.
title: EU Climate Push Comes Under Pressure With France Flagging Risks

author: Ashleigh Furlong
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said the US will cut funding to the organization responsible for vaccinating children in poor countries, a move experts warned will result in unnecessary deaths.
title: RFK Jr. Pulls US Funding for Vaccines for the World’s Poorest

author: Valentina Fuentes
description: Using tactics that could have won her a prize for investigative journalism, Chile’s unassuming comptroller general is shaking up the nation’s sclerotic public sector in her war on waste.
title: Chile Catches Thousands of Workers Holidaying at State’s Expense

author: Laura Nahmias, Gregory Korte, Nacha Cattan
description: Andrew Cuomo’s loss is Eric Adams’ gain.
title: Mamdani Shock Gives NYC Mayor Adams a Shot at Making a Comeback

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: For those concerned about Iran becoming a nuclear-armed state, it’s essential to understand not just what the attacks by the US and Israel did to the country’s capacity to enrich uranium, but also its existing inventory of atomic fuel.
title: Why Iran’s Unaccounted for Uranium Worries Nuclear Experts

author: Firat Kozok, Baris Balci
description: The former leader of Turkey’s main opposition party said he’s willing to return to the post if a court invalidates the vote that removed him, a move that could divide the opposition and derail its efforts to challenge President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: Turkish Opposition Risks New Crisis as Ex-Leader Eyes Comeback

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Angola won’t seek a loan from the International Monetary Fund for now, as Africa’s third-biggest crude producer benefits from rising oil prices.
title: Oil-Price Surge Helps Angola Put Plan to Borrow From IMF on Hold

author: Patrick Sykes, Eltaf Najafizada
description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei claimed victory in the war with Israel and said the US’s intervention achieved nothing, in his first comments since a ceasefire came into effect Tuesday.
title: Iran’s Khamenei Says US Intervention in War Achieved Nothing

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India declined to back a joint statement at the China-led Shanghai Cooperation Organization meet, marking a rare public rift within the security bloc and highlighting unresolved tensions following its near-war with Pakistan last month.
title: India Rejects Joint Defense Statement at Key China-Led Summit

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniele Lepido
description: Italy’s state railway Ferrovie dello Stato SpA is moving ahead with plans to sell minority stakes in its high-speed train network, Chief Executive Officer Stefano Donnarumma said.
title: Italy’s Ferrovie Chief Says He’s Ready to Sell High Speed Rail Network Stake

author: S'thembile Cele, Paul Vecchiatto
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa fired a deputy minister from the second-largest party in the ruling coalition on Thursday, a move that could test the stability of his administration.
title: South African Deputy Minister’s Firing Tests Coalition

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel has estimated the cost of damages incurred during its 12-day war with Iran at 10 billion shekels ($3 billion), with funds needed both to repair missile-hit buildings and pay compensation to local businesses.
title: Iran Caused $3 Billion of Damage With Missile Strikes on Israel

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is weighing changes to his cabinet, including removing the nation’s deputy trade minister who’s a member of the second-largest party in the ruling coalition.
title: South African President Weighing Changes to Cabinet, News24 Says

author: David Herbling
description: At least 16 people died after Kenyan police cracked down on anti-government protests across the country on Wednesday, human-rights groups said.
title: Kenyan Protest Death Toll Climbs to 16 After Police Crackdown

author: Gregory Korte
description: Zohran Mamdani’s ascendancy has rocked the political establishment in the world’s financial capital
title: New York’s Leftward Shift Jolts US Politics

author: Daniel Basteiro, Ben Sills
description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez defended his decision to break with his NATO allies over increases in military spending and called President Donald Trump’s threat to impose higher tariffs on Spain “doubly unfair.”
title: Spain’s Leader Calls Trump Tariffs ‘Doubly Unfair’ in Trade Spat

author: Joe Mayes, Freya Jones
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer acknowledged the impact his government’s tax increases have had on UK firms as he faces strong calls from business to resist further hikes in the autumn budget.
title: Starmer Acknowledges Asking ‘a Lot’ of UK Firms With Tax Hikes

author: William Horobin
description: France’s government said it will need to cut spending by an extra €5 billion ($5.9 billion) this year to meet its deficit reduction target after seeing some slippage from the initial budget plan.
title: France to Curb Spending as Government Sees Slippage From Plans

author: Nancy Cook, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump is pivoting his attention to passing the cornerstone of his legislative agenda, pressuring Congress to quickly approve a massive tax bill that Republicans believe will seal their political fortunes in the midterm elections.
title: Trump Pivots to Tax Cuts to Combat Voters’ Economic Anxiety

author: Alex Morales
description: Nigel Farage’s populist Reform UK would be the biggest party in parliament if the country held a general election today, according to a nationwide projection, underlining the political danger to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Farage’s Reform Would Come Top in UK Election, YouGov Finds

author: Samuel Stolton, Oliver Crook
description: The European Union’s crackdown on Apple Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., and Alphabet Inc.’s Google isn’t a bargaining chip in trade negotiations with US President Donald Trump, according to Teresa Ribera, the EU’s competition chief.
title: EU’s Ribera Won’t Trade Big Tech Rules to Placate Trump

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s €46 billion ($53 billion) package of tax breaks was approved by Germany’s lower house of parliament, paving the way for the measures to get final ratification in the upper house on July 11.
title: German Lawmakers Back Merz’s €46 Billion Package of Tax Breaks

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban hailed the result of a government survey that showed Hungarians overwhelmingly against Ukraine’s European Union accession, and which critics derided as propaganda aimed at reversing his fading popularity.
title: Orban Touts Anti-Ukraine Survey to Boost His Flagging Campaign

author: Hallie Gu
description: China is loosening its ban on urea exports, a move likely to ease surging international prices that have been buoyed by tension in the Middle East.
title: China to Relax Urea Export Ban, Easing Global Price Pressure

author: Alex Wickham, Julian Harris
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer looks ready to water down another of the UK government’s key policies, offering concessions to stop Labour party colleagues derailing his reforms to Britain’s expensive welfare payments.
title: Starmer in Talks With Labour Rebels About Easing Welfare Cuts

author: Leonard Kehnscherper
description: The UK government should act to stem an exodus of wealthy foreigners from the country following a major tax crackdown, said Alastair King, Lord Mayor of the City of London.
title: UK’s Labour Needs to Contain Non-Dom Exodus, Lord Mayor Says

author: Tala Ahmadi
description: According to new polling, the far-right party led by Nigel Farage now stands at 34% support, nine points ahead of Labour and well ahead of the Conservatives.
title: Is the Anti-Immigrant Reform UK Ready to Take Charge?

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s chief trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said the country can’t accept the US’s 25% tariffs on cars, adding that the Asian nation’s automakers produce far more cars in the US than they export to America.
title: Japan Can’t Accept US’s 25% Car Tariffs, Akazawa Reiterates

author: Anisah Shukry
description: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission plans to seek forfeiture of 177 million ringgit ($41.8 million) in assets and cash it seized in its probe into former prime minister Ismail Sabri Yaakob, the New Straits Times reported.
title: Malaysian Agency to Forfeit $41.8M Linked to Ex-PM Probe: NST
